Alastir
Tuesday, August 22nd, 2017, 12:41:51 AM

@Wyrom posted Bloodforge and Smelter Open

I've gone ahead and opened the bloodforge and smelter. The blacksmith assistant in the workshop is just a husk right now. You can go ahead and transmute pendants or try out the new smelter. The smelter area works like the one at Ebon Gate. Just ASK MINER about COST and ASK MINER about ORE.

We're still working on the smithy. More information will be posted about weighting/padding before the smithy opens.

Wyrom, PM

Alastir
Tuesday, August 22nd, 2017, 12:44:01 AM

[Bloodforge, Workshop - 26091]

Piles of crimson powder cover the floor beneath a large opening.

ask miner about ore * The dwarven miner turns to you and says, "No refunds, remember! Ask me again if you're sure." ask miner about cost * The dwarven miner turns to you and says, "Each chunk of ore costs 5 bloodscrip.

0zymandius
Tuesday, August 22nd, 2017, 8:08:56 AM

So... I just got an invite on my warrior... which is something I did NOT expect to happen. I was just happily farming BS as best I could. But now I'm trying to figure out if I have a good project to get worked on (and enough BS to make it happen).

I understand details have been scarce (though I did read the vague teaser about number of 'services' and their cost), but I was trying to figure out... is this the point at which weighting/padding will be able to be added to flaring items? Or do I need to be looking to get a 'vanilla' item worked on? The best thing I have that would benefit (at least at the moment) is some nice flaring UAC gear, but if I need to pursue something else, I can do that. Just not sure if we know yet what the parameters are going to be.

OldSkool
Tuesday, August 22nd, 2017, 10:02:02 AM

There are some rather important unknowns at this time. We don't know how padding/weighting will scale. We don't know what one "service" adds. We do know that you can get up to 25 of them on one item.

I believe that you can have one service performed per invitation. If that's correct, you will need 25 invites to max out an item. That's no small feat, considering how many people seem to have gone through multiple books without an invite, and I don't know too many people who are going to do 25-50 books to hit that threshold. I hope I'm mistaken, here.

I hate it, because I like TES :p.

The reason TES was a GREAT series is that after a short while, you eventually become a god. You can walk anywhere in the world, and just flatten anything that stands in your way. Sure, you start out where a bear can kill you, and those giants were dangerous for a while, but eventually, you get to the point where you can Crit kill the final boss in the game with a single arrow.

This doesn't translate well to MMOs.
